recipe.title: Sichuan Shredded Vegetables with Ginger Dressing
recipe.description: *we used lettuce stem but also good would be green papaya, cucumber, carrot, lotus root, daikon radish or any other crunchy and slightly watery vegetable One 2 inch chunk of ginger root, peeled and minced superfine ('like mud' as Feng would say)

directions.step: Mix the finely minced ginger with the salt, splash of boiling water and sesame oil and set aside while you chop the vegetables.

Peel your vegetables and slice off any rounded edges so that they sit nice and flat on your chopping board. Slice them first into thin slices, then carefully line up your slices and chop into fine matchsticks. Scatter on a plate.
Scoop out 2 tbsp of the wet ginger from your ginger/water mixture and place in a small bowl. Add the 2 tbsp of water, vinegar and salt and stir. Add the sesame oil and stir gently.

Pour over the vegetables and either leave for 20 minutes for the vegetables to soak up some of the liquid and 'pickle' slightly or eat straight away. This would also be a great dish to bring along for picnics.
